name: document
title: Document
description: Information about annotations for a single document.

name.description: The document filename (without any extension) - a unique value in the dataset. In the scope of our dataset, the filename is our identifier.

split.description: Split type, one of: train, dev, test.

identifier.description: An identifier, such as an original document ID, URL, ISBN, DOI, or a Compact Identifier (the document can have more than one identifier).

original_name.description: Filename in source/original dataset (we can modify original document names in case of duplicates).

tags.description: List of all tags related to the document.

metadata.description: Dictionary for storing any extra data related to the document.

id.description: Annotation dataset ID (unique for one dataset).

key.description: Annotation key, eg. name of the entity for KIE task OR question for QA task.

values.description: List of all annotation values for one key (it is possible to have more than one correct value), for most cases it will be a single element list.

value_variants.description: List of all possible value variants which are also correct, eg. [John Kennedy, Kennedy, John F. Kennedy] (should also contain `base value`).

children.description: List of children Annotations - if we want to represent hierarchical structure.

tags.description: List of all tags related to the annotation.

metadata.description: Dictionary for storing any extra data related to the annotation.
